newsitem.title: MEXICO: Weekly Mexican export, import feeder summary -USDA.
newsitem.headline: Weekly Mexican export, import feeder summary -USDA.

text.p: USDA said Friday that numbers of steer calves exported to the United States from Mexico were not sufficient to establish quote prices.
Exports for the week were estimated at 3,000 head into Texas and New Mexico against 5,843 head last week and 5,342 head in the same week in 1996.
"Around 90 percent of supply were previously contracted, sold on video..." USDA said. "Bulk of supply consisted of steers weighing 300-600 lb," it added.
Imports into Mexico of slaughter cattle were estimated to have totaled 3,000 head for the week, it added.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom +525 7289530)). E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com
